channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Three brothers cleaned out their mom’s attic — and found a $9 million Superman that just became the most expensive comic ever sold
item.description: The comic "could've easily been thrown away," one brother marveled.

item.title: Apple is cutting jobs: these teams will be impacted by layoffs

item.title: City of 11,000 reels from ‘gut punch’ after Big Meat firm closes plant that employs nearly a third of the population
item.description: Amid record high beef prices, Tyson's recent moves are set to reduce beef processing capacity nationwide by 7%-9%.

item.title: ‘I’m not going back’: Billionaire Marc Benioff says he’s switching to Google’s Gemini 3 after using ‘ChatGPT every day for three years’
item.description: Despite Salesforce’s new deal with OpenAI, Benioff is now more excited about Google’s latest offering. “It feels like the world just changed, again.”

item.title: Trump Keeps Investing Millions of Government Money in 1 Essential Industry (and It’s Not AI Chips)
item.description: A new report shows how the feds are increasingly appearing on cap tables of U.S. companies.

item.title: How This Social Media-Inspired Trend Threatens Workplace Stability
item.description: Described as a version of ‘failure videos,’ the trend of workers watching colleagues’ make mistakes risks undermining workplace cohesion.

item.title: Entrepreneurs Think Higher Holiday Sales Will Set Up 2026 Growth
item.description: New survey data shows 87 percent of small business owners think holiday season sales will top 2024 — and fuel revenue grow next year.

item.title: How to Put Humans Back in HR in the AI Age
item.description: American hiring managers are more hands-on than they have been in previous years thanks to a flood of AI-assisted job applications.
